cluster_relations.rel_desc: A furrowed brow is said to indicate the state of confusion.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: A nonverbal facial expression functions as a signal that conveys or indicates a person's underlying emotional state.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: A furrowed brow is also linked to the emotional state of concern.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Facial expressions are said to signal how a person is feeling, i.e., their emotions.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: A nonverbal facial expression functions as a signal that conveys or indicates a person's underlying emotional state.
remarks: Object mapped to general 'emotions' entity since 'how a person is feeling' denotes emotional states.

      "canonical_rel_name": "indicates_internal_state",
      "canonical_rel_desc": "A nonverbal behavior or facial expression functions as a cue that indicates or signals an internal or inferred psychological or attitudinal state of a person.",
      "rel_cls": "nonverbal_state_cue_relation",
      "rel_cls_group": "COMMUNICATION",
      "justification": "All relations connect a nonverbal behavior or facial expression (gestures, posture, eye contact, facial expressions) to an inferred internal state (emotions, attitudes such as concern, defensiveness, agreement, etc.). The current split into two canonical_rel_names ('signals_emotional_state' vs. 'indicates_state'), two rel_cls values ('nonverbal_signal_relation' vs. 'nonverbal_indicator_relation'), and two rel_cls_groups ('COMMUNICATION' vs. 'ASSOCIATION') is artificial: semantically they are all nonverbal cues that communicate internal states, regardless of whether the object is strictly emotional or more generally psychological/attitudinal. Unifying them under 'indicates_internal_state', with a single class 'nonverbal_state_cue_relation' and broad group 'COMMUNICATION', yields a cleaner, more reusable predicate and avoids redundant, slightly different labels for the same relation family.",
      "remark": "Harmonized facial-expression and body-language indicator relations into a single predicate and class to reflect that they are all communicative nonverbal cues of internal states.",
      "confidence": 0.9
    }
  }
]

args.canonical_rel_desc: A nonverbal behavior or facial expression functions as a cue that indicates or signals an internal or inferred psychological or attitudinal state of a person.
args.justification: All relations connect a nonverbal behavior or facial expression (gestures, posture, eye contact, facial expressions) to an inferred internal state (emotions, attitudes such as concern, defensiveness, agreement, etc.). The current split into two canonical_rel_names ('signals_emotional_state' vs. 'indicates_state'), two rel_cls values ('nonverbal_signal_relation' vs. 'nonverbal_indicator_relation'), and two rel_cls_groups ('COMMUNICATION' vs. 'ASSOCIATION') is artificial: semantically they are all nonverbal cues that communicate internal states, regardless of whether the object is strictly emotional or more generally psychological/attitudinal. Unifying them under 'indicates_internal_state', with a single class 'nonverbal_state_cue_relation' and broad group 'COMMUNICATION', yields a cleaner, more reusable predicate and avoids redundant, slightly different labels for the same relation family.
args.remark: Harmonized facial-expression and body-language indicator relations into a single predicate and class to reflect that they are all communicative nonverbal cues of internal states.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: A nonverbal behavior or facial expression functions as a cue that indicates or signals an internal or inferred psychological or attitudinal state of a person.
executed_decisions.justification: All relations connect a nonverbal behavior or facial expression (gestures, posture, eye contact, facial expressions) to an inferred internal state (emotions, attitudes such as concern, defensiveness, agreement, etc.). The current split into two canonical_rel_names ('signals_emotional_state' vs. 'indicates_state'), two rel_cls values ('nonverbal_signal_relation' vs. 'nonverbal_indicator_relation'), and two rel_cls_groups ('COMMUNICATION' vs. 'ASSOCIATION') is artificial: semantically they are all nonverbal cues that communicate internal states, regardless of whether the object is strictly emotional or more generally psychological/attitudinal. Unifying them under 'indicates_internal_state', with a single class 'nonverbal_state_cue_relation' and broad group 'COMMUNICATION', yields a cleaner, more reusable predicate and avoids redundant, slightly different labels for the same relation family.
executed_decisions.remark: Harmonized facial-expression and body-language indicator relations into a single predicate and class to reflect that they are all communicative nonverbal cues of internal states.
